intro: Tithymalus megalanthus, commonly known as the giant tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its foliage is broad and lance-shaped, with a somewhat hairy texture. The flowers, which bloom in late summer, are yellow and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
